intro.description:
This cheat sheet will guide you through the process of creating a new oAW-based MDSD generator.
You will create a new oAW project with a sample metamodel and try it out.
Let's get started!

item.title: Open the openArchitectureWare perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the openArchitectureWare perspective, in the main menu select "Window > Open Perspective > Other... > openArchitectureWare" or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create a new oAW project
item.description: Metamodel definitions and model transformations must reside in special openArchitectureWare projects. In the main toolbar, click in the "New" button and select "openArchitectureWare Project" from the list, or click on the link below. Enter "HelloGenerator" for the project name. Make sure you have ticked the "Create a sample model" check box, then click "Finish".

item.title: Running the generator
item.description:
The oAW wizard has created a new project containing a sample metamodel, a sample model, some templates and a workflow file.
The workflow file "workflow.oaw", located in "src/workflow" controls the bahaviour of the generator. In the next step, you'll run the generator using the workflow definition.
To do so, select the workflow file in the package explorer and start the workflow by selecting "Run As > oAW Workflow" from the context menu.
